title: Unauthorized Team members viewing

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
In a Team, a user that does not have an admin permission at https://hackerone.com/[team_name]/team_members can view the list of users in the Program by visiting 
https://hackerone.com/[team_name]/team_members.json
Although it is only a user with an admin permission that can view the Team members and modify their permission, but other members that do not have such right can view ALL the members in the Team.
vulnerability_information_html:
In a Team, a user that does not have an admin permission at https://hackerone.com/%5Bteam_name%5D/team_members can view the list of users in the Program by visiting
https://hackerone.com/%5Bteam_name%5D/team_members.json
Although it is only a user with an admin permission that can view the Team members and modify their permission, but other members that do not have such right can view ALL the members in the Team.

activities.message:
For the reports overview you can filter on team members. For the autosuggest function we need all the team members so that's why the `.json` endpoint is accessible. 

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
For the reports overview you can filter on team members. For the autosuggest function we need all the team members so that's why the .json endpoint is accessible.

Thanks!

activities.message:
To me it seems like you fixed this bug and you marked it as informative. is there a something i should know about this report?


Kind Regards
*Temmy*
activities.markdown_message:
To me it seems like you fixed this bug and you marked it as informative. is there a something i should know about this report?

Kind Regards
Temmy

activities.message:
I can no longer reproduce it anymore.
and an additional information which means you fixed this bug is  that:
* For a `team member` of a Program, he cannot access https://hackerone.com/[team]/team_members.json he will get an `{"status":"406","error":"Not Acceptable"}` response
* Now for an ordinary member that is **NOT** a `team_member` of the team, if he visits the link he will get a blank page.

 These new behaviors shows that this bug has been fixed


Regards
*Temmy*
activities.markdown_message:
I can no longer reproduce it anymore.
and an additional information which means you fixed this bug is that:

  • For a team member of a Program, he cannot access https://hackerone.com/%5Bteam%5D/team_members.json he will get an {"status":"406","error":"Not Acceptable"} response
  • Now for an ordinary member that is NOT a team_member of the team, if he visits the link he will get a blank page.

These new behaviors shows that this bug has been fixed

Regards
Temmy

activities.message:
Hello @temmyscript, 

The original report was not considered valid, since if a user is using the autosuggest function, they would be able to manually scroll through their team members. Meaning, the info that you could retrieve with team_members.json was already exposed in other functions. Since the json provides nothing new, this was not considered information disclosure. 

As you can imagine, we are a company with active engineering efforts  - meaning that we always actively have code changes in our codebase. We had recently done a complete refactor around permissions and authorization for endpoints (for reports that I'm sure you've seen - where there had been disclosures of data that was *otherwise unable to retrieve*, and where the user was *under no reason supposed to see*), and are still continuing to improve our consistency in the platform. The change you see is related to enforcing ideal code hygiene. 

This behaviour that you had outlined before did not leak any information. My colleague closed it as Informative (even though it should have been NA, since it was not an issue). Our code change happened to change the behaviour of team_members.json, but it did not remove the data that used to be shown - again, a team member can still easily use the autosuggest function to get the same info. 

Therefore we do not consider your report an issue. We merely improved out codebase - we did not "fix" what you reported. We hope you understand our decisions. We invite you to report issues should you find leakage of data where the user otherwise cannot access, and should not access. 

Best,
HackerOne
